All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ActionState
Enumeration which identifies the different phases of a player's turn
App
Used to start the client or the server
AppTest
Unit test for simple App.
AssistantCard
Represents the Assistant Card
AssistantCardPlayed
Extends Client Message Notifies to play an Assistant Card
AssistantDeckName
Enumeration
CardEffect
Enumeration which identifies the effect of a certain Character Card
CharacterCard
Represents the Character Card
CharacterCardController
 
CharacterCardPlayed
Extends Server Message Asks to play a Character Card
ChooseCloudCard
Extends server Message Asks the Cloud card chosen by a player
ChooseColor
Extends Server Message Asks the color to block chosen by the player
ChooseId
Extends Server Message Asks the student id to move
ChooseMotherEarthSteps
Extends Server Message Asks Mother Earth steps
ChoosePlaceAndStudentForMove
Extends Server Message Asks where to move a certain student
ChooseTowerColorAndDeck
Extends Server Message Asks to choose tower color and Assistant Deck
CLI
Implements the CLI (command line interface)
ClientHandler
Represents the client seen from the server Handles messages received from the client and sends messages from the Game Controller to the client
ClientHandlerInterface
Handles messages sent to a client
ClientMessage
Interface used for all the messages sent from the client
ClientMessanger
Gets inputs from the View and notifies the view and sends them as messages Also notifies the View that a certain message has arrived
ClientSocket
Implements the connection between client and server, seen from the client
CloudCard
Represents the Cloud Card
CloudCards
This Scene Controller is used to make the player choose between 2 or more cloud cards
CloudChosen
Extends Client Message Notifies the cloud card chosen by a player
ColorBlocked
Extends Client Message Notifies the color blocked by the player Used in Expert Mode
ColorChoice
This Scene Controller is used to tell the player he tied the match
ConnectToServerScene
This Scene Controller is used to allow the player to connect to the server
DashboardScene
This Scene Controller is used to manage the main scene of the game
DeckAssistant
Implements the Assistant Deck composed of the 10 Assistant cards
DeckAssistantTest
 
DeckCharacter
Implements the Character Deck composed of the 12 Character cards
DeckCharacterTest
 
Difficulty
Enumeration which identifies the difficulty for a certain match
EndScene
 
Error
Extends Server Message This message contains a generic error String
Game
Connects the game components
GameController
Manages the game evolution Reads messages from the clients Sends messages to the Virtual Views
GameControllerTest
 
GameMode
Enumeration which identifies the number of players for a certain match
GameState
Enumeration which identifies different phases of the game
GeneralMessage
Used to allow the serialization of all the messages
GenericScene
Interface which is used to define all the Scene Controllers
GUI
Implements the GUI (graphical user interface)
GuiManager
Handles the change of each Scene in GUI
HostGameReply
Extends Server Message Notifies when a player chose players number and difficulty
IdChosen
Extends Client Message Notifies the student to move
IslandCard
Represents the Island Card
IslandTest
 
Lobby
Keeps track all the clients connected to a certain lobby, playing in the same match
LobbyForPrint
Collects infos of each lobby available showing them to a new player who wants to join an existing match
LobbyServer
Allows multiple games to be played at the same time
LobbyServerInfo
Extends Server Message Contains lobby's info to show
LobbyServerRequest
Extends Client Message Notifies lobby's infos
LoginRequest
Extends Client Message Notifies the login from a certain user
LoginResult
Extends Server Message Shows if the login was successful
LoseMessage
Extends Server Message Notifies a player that he lost the match
LoserScene
This Scene Controller is used to tell the player he lost the match
MessageScene
This Scene Controller is used to show a generic message
MessageType
Enumeration which identifies every kind of message between the client and the server
MotherEarthStepsChosen
Extends Server Message Notifies Mother Earth steps chosen by the player
NewGameScene
This Scene Controller is used to create a new lobby
Observable
Default Observable class
ObservableView
Default Observable class which can be observed from ObserverView
Observer
Default Observer interface
ObserverView
Default Observer interface for the view
PlaceAndStudentForMoveChosen
Extends Client Message Notifies where to move a certain student
PlayAssistantCard
Extends Server Message Notifies Assistant Card to play
PlayCharacterCard
Extends ServerMessage Notifies the Character Card played
Player
Represents the player and contains all his information
PlayerNumber
Enumeration which identifies all possible player's number
PlayersNumberAndDifficulty
Extends Client Message Notifies the number of players and the difficulty of the match chosen by the player
PlayerTest
 
Prof
Represents the pawn Professor
ReadFromInput
Reads commands from input stream
School
Represents School's board Composed by entry, student's hall, professor's hall and tower zone
SchoolController
This Scene Controller is used to update and play with a specific personal school It also updates the schools of the other players
SColor
Enumeration which identifies all possible student's colors It also identifies all professor's colors
ServerMessage
Shows all the messages from the server
SetupGameScene
This Scene Controller is used to take part to a match It saves all the infos of a new player, allowing him to create a new lobby or to join a lobby already existing
ShowAssistantDeck
Extends Server Message Shows the player his Deck Assistant
ShowCoinAndCharacterCards
Extends Server Message Shows the player the coins and the Character cards on table
ShowListOfIslands
Extends Server Message Shows the list of islands currently on the table
ShowPersonalSchool
Extends Server message Shows each player's personal school
ShowTable
Extends Server Message Shows the current situation on table
StartClient
Starts the client
StartGameScene
This Scene Controller is used to start the game
StartGUI
Starts the GUI
StartServer
Starts the Server
StringMessage
Extends Server Message This message contains a generic String
StringWaitingMessage
Extends Server Message This message contains a generic waiting String
Student
Represents the pawn Student
Table
Represents the Table where are placed all the components of the game
TableTest
 
TColor
Enumeration which identifies all possible tower's colors
Team
Represents the Team consisting of two players This class is used only in COOP mode (GameMode with 4 players)
TeamTest
 
TieScene
This Scene Controller is used to tell the player he tied the match
Tower
Represents the pawn Tower
TowerAndDeckScene
This Scene Controller is used to select Tower's color and Deck Assistant It saves all the infos of each player, and hides the item already chosen
TowerColorAndDeckChosen
Extends Client Message Notifies tower color and deck assistant chosen by a player
TurnController
Manage the flow of the turns during the match
TurnControllerTest
 
View
Represents the generic View implemented by CLI and GUI
ViewDeckScene
This Scene Controller is used to update player's Assistant Deck and play a specific Assistant card
ViewOtherSchoolScene1
This Scene Controller is used to show and update other players' school and trash card Used in Two Players Mode
ViewOtherSchoolScene2
This Scene Controller is used to show and update other players' school and trash card Used in Three Players Mode
ViewOtherSchoolScene3
This Scene Controller is used to show and update other players' school and trash card Used in COOP mode (4 players)
VirtualView
Hides the network implementation from the controller The controller calls methods from this class instead of calling methods from the view
WaitingScene
This Scene Controller is used to implement a generic scene
WinMessage
Extends ServerMessage Notifies a player that he won the match
WinnerScene
This Scene Controller is used to tell the player he won the match
